December 15, 1961
Mr. Loren B. Stone
Manager, KCTS-TV
University of Washington
Seattle 5, Washington
Dear Loren:
The matter you referred to in your letter concerning the American
Council on Education was really a vote to accept a contract from Title VII
to organize a study of copyrights and compensation for educational
broadcasting.
Dr. Stone has told me that this will be divided into sections and
portions of it subcontracted or at least a great many of the interested
groups will be brought into the study and given ample opportunity to
present their views; in fact, they will be requested to provide their ex¬
pert insights into the problem. He assured me that NAEB would be in¬
volved in any such consideration. Thus, actually, I think this is proba¬
bly a pretty good way to handle it. As you know, NAEB has been talk¬
ing about the need for doing this kind of thing for a long time but it was
really too big a problem for us to undertake. As a matter of fact, there
is really no one organization capable of doing it although the American
Council probably comes as close to it as any. Evem so, many organizag
tions and groups need to be brought into this study for it has widespread
ramifications throughout the entire educational community.
The main thing is to rejoice that ad&Lon is finally going to be
taken on this matter that we have all talked about for so long as a
pressing need. I assure you that when time is ripe for the Television
Board you will be so informed.
Congratulations on the handsome booklet about Channel 9. That's
one of the most attractive promotion pieces I have seen come out of any
ETV shop.
Cordially yours.
William G. Harley
WGHradt
